review_text: This phone deserves good as it is a great phone with great spces. At same price many manufacture like Micromax, Lava, Intex etc are selling crappy hardware but Meizu is selling a great phone.

Solid touch. Bright and vibrant display. Very responsive...was extremely impressed. Off the bat runs a keyboard called TouchPal which I junked in favour of GBoard by installing from apk before logging on to google. Other than that no bloatware. I didnt test the camera. If this phone is priced 5K then 5K phones have come far in the last few years. Would recommend.

After struggling with a string of FlymeOS phones from Meizu, I bought this one for the stock Android. Other than the low (16 GB) memory, there i nothing much to complain about. The size is perfect, it has two SIM and an exclusive SD slot AND no crapware! Google services works without fuss, and the face recognition is great too!

I bought it for around 4k and at that price range it sure is great. The picture quality is good, it has 13 mp back and 8 front and the quality is good just as you would expect. The build quality is not that great it's kinda delicate so you must buy a hard case. And it's light weight.
comparing the price, i believe its good deal. Most of features are as advertised. This is utility phone.

Meizu is a great brand and produce quality products but it has scanty presence of service centers.Thus in case of a defective set you will go from pillar to post to find a center.Unless it goes full hog to provide basic repair facility in India it has no future in India.Otherwise it is a good product worth a buy.

Very handy, it has great form factor. I am an iPhone SE user and bought this phone as a second device for a VoLTE usage. However, I was amazed by the performance for this small stock android beast. It is flawless. Not for heavy usage but can be easily used as a second device.
